forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am, then a slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 60. South southwest wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of the day embrace Downtown San Francisco, a gentle hush envelopes the city, interrupted only by the faint sighs of a southern wind that carries whispers of impending drizzle. With a low around 60 degrees, the air feels heavy yet inviting, hinting at a dance of moisture that could grace the streets before dawn truly breaks. The overarching clouds wrap the skyline, shrouding the city's ambitions in a soft gray that lends an air of mystery. As the sun prepares to unfurl its warmth, the day promises a partially sunny disposition, coaxing the temperature to a comfortable high near 68, diminishing to a gentle 66 in the afternoon, as the clouds slowly begin to part.

If venturing out in this tranquil backdrop, a light jacket would be more than sufficient; the chill of the evening lingers, yet the day ahead holds the promise of brightness and warmth. Consider a stroll through one of the quieter neighborhoods, perhaps indulging in a leisurely coffee at a local café or exploring nooks and corners relatively untouched by the ebb and flow of the weekend crowds. The weather, while not of the postcard-perfect variety, carries with it a subdued charm that is best appreciated in moments of reflection and soft conversation. It invites you to notice the beauty of the mundane, as the marine layer rests lovingly at the city's edges, a reminder of the coastal embrace that defines this unique enclave.
